Key Match Events: Brandon Marsh hit a three-run homer in the sixth inning against Charlie Morton.
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning to win the game for the Phillies.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos mentioned that Marsh's homer jumpstarted everything.
Braves manager Brian Snitker reflected on the decision to keep Morton in the game, noting that he liked the matchup.
Brandon Marsh admitted he thought he hit the ball too high but was glad it went out.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Marsh's performance, emphasizing his use of the field.
Brandon Marsh discussed his approach and the importance of not overthinking at the plate.
Nick Castellanos reflected on his at-bat strategy against the Braves' pitchers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alec Bohm was replaced due to an injury to his left hand, and X-rays were negative.
The Phillies went to bed with a six-game lead in the division.
